recipe.title: Avocado and Tomatillo Salsa
recipe.description: This salsa makes for a great alternative to more common tomato salsas and is wonderful served with crab cakes, fish tacos or just as a dip for tortilla chips. It is also great tucked into flour tortillas with fried eggs and a few shavings of Manchego for breakfast.

directions.step: Place the tomatillos in a food processor and pulse until coarsely chopped. You are looking for a textured salsa rather than a smooth puree. Remove the tomatillos to a bowl and stir in the onion, garlic and coriander.

Cut the avocados in half and scoop out the flesh with a tablespoon. Mash the avocados roughly with a fork so that they are still chunky and fold them through the tomatillo mixture. Taste and season generously with salt.
